intro: Hieracium mutinense, commonly known as the Mutinense hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers in a single head. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant is perennial and often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the hawkweed genus.
